intro: Tococa poortmannii, commonly known as the Poortmann's tococa, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
